results.title: Breakthroughs in Quantum Computing - Wevolver
results.content:
Another recent pivotal development in the quantum computing field was the shift from emphasizing processor benchmarks to focusing on practical implementations. This transition is vital for transforming quantum computing from a theoretical concept into an applied technology with real-world applications. An updated analysis for 2023 projects indicates that industries like automotive, chemicals, financial services, and life sciences could see an economic impact of up to $1.3 trillion by 2035, [...] Conclusion
2023 was a transformative year for quantum computing, marked by remarkable achievements and promising trends that extended beyond academia to practical, real-world applications. These developments, led by collaborations between industry giants and leading universities, pave the way for quantum technologies that promise to revolutionize fields like cryptography, medicine, and energy. [...] Introduction
2023 was a landmark year for quantum computing, with innovative breakthroughs promising to reshape our technological landscape and revolutionize how we solve complex problems and process information. From IBM's groundbreaking quantum chips to pioneering experiments in manipulating spin waves, the simulation of molecular structures, and quantum communication, the landscape of quantum computing is undergoing a transformation that will redefine our technological future.[1]

results.title: What Is The Quantum Computing Breakthroughs 2023? - Consensus
results.content:
Conclusion
The breakthroughs in quantum computing in 2023 highlight the rapid progress and growing maturity of this transformative technology. While significant challenges remain, the advancements in quantum supremacy, hybrid computing platforms, and hardware development are promising steps toward realizing the full potential of quantum computing. As the field continues to evolve, it is poised to bring unprecedented computational power and innovation across various domains.
See sources [...] Quantum computing has emerged as a revolutionary technology with the potential to transform various fields by leveraging principles of quantum mechanics such as superposition and entanglement. The year 2023 has seen significant strides in both quantum hardware and software, bringing us closer to practical and scalable quantum computers .
Quantum Supremacy and Quantum Advantage [...] Applications and Future Directions
Quantum computing holds promise for solving intractable problems in diverse fields such as drug design, data science, clean energy, finance, and quantum chemistry. The ongoing advancements in quantum software tools, post-quantum cryptography, and hardware development are paving the way for practical applications of quantum computing . Researchers are also focusing on improving the accuracy of quantum gates and achieving fully fault-tolerant quantum computing.

results.title: 2023: A Year of Growth and Collaboration for Quantum Computing
results.content:
The achievements in 2023 are strong evidence of  the positive trajectory of the industry, with numerous innovations from many different quantum computing companies, global expansion of the technology, and cross-sector collaborations vital to the development and implementation of quantum computing.
Breakthroughs [...] By John Levy
CEO, Co-Founder and Chair, SEEQC
In 2023, the quantum ecosystem experienced significant strides in research and development, with companies big and small contributing to the industry’s overarching goals. [...] For quantum computing to make the global impact that it has the ability to do, nations must collaborate for the growth and betterment of the technology. These achievements from 2023 paint a picture of a flourishing global industry, and 2024 will bring more important developments for international quantum computing.
Collaboration opens the door for quantum’s future

results.title: What's next for quantum computing | MIT Technology Review
results.content:
Stephanie Arnett/MITTR; Getty
This story is a part of MIT Technology Review’s What’s Next series, where we look across industries, trends, and technologies to give you a first look at the future
In 2023, progress in quantum computing will be defined less by big hardware announcements than by researchers consolidating years of hard work, getting chips to talk to one another, and shifting away from trying to make do with noise as the field gets ever more international in scope. [...] The desire to shuttle qubits among processors means that a somewhat neglected quantum technology will come to the fore now, according to Jack Hidary, CEO of SandboxAQ, a quantum technology company that was spun out of Alphabet last year. Quantum communications, where coherent qubits are transferred over distances as large as hundreds of kilometers, will be an essential part of the quantum computing story in 2023, he says. [...] In Japan, Fujitsu is working with the Riken research institute to offer companies access to the country’s first home-grown quantum computer in the fiscal year starting April 2023. It will have 64 superconducting qubits. “The initial focus will be on applications for materials development, drug discovery, and finance,” says Shintaro Sato, head of the quantum laboratory at Fujitsu Research.

results.answer: In 2023, quantum computing saw significant progress in practical applications and international collaboration, with notable advancements in quantum communication and hardware development. Quantum computing's potential economic impact was projected to reach $1.3 trillion by 2035. Quantum supremacy and hybrid computing platforms were major breakthroughs.
